title: Game-Based Social Learning Leadership Workshop: Experiential Education Design Using Digital Games

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of elementary curriculum and social studies education basics, with foundational digital media experience
context.additional_context: Practice-centered program for education administrators/leaders to enhance game-based learning design competencies linked to social studies curricula

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the educational applicability of *Assassinâ€™s Creed Odyssey: Discovery Tour* and derive over 3 social studies-linked scenarios.
Learners can systematize the strengths and weaknesses of digital game-based instruction into evaluation criteria and suggest over 5 factors to consider when applying it in educational settings.
Learners can design mini-projects (e.g., history exploration quiz games) incorporating smartphone-based game elements and improve them by reflecting peer feedback.

resources: Team-Based Project Production Kit (Mini Game Board, Card Set)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
